page.title: 08FARMING AROUND TYWARDREATH
page.content: We looked at a survey of{farming}from 20 years ago and nowadays far less people are employed. Most farms are{ {run by the family}with fathers and sons or brothers working in partnership to share machinery and equipment. Only about 6 full time workers are employed - half of them are girls - but extra help is taken on at harvest time. Many farms in the area are{mixed {farms,}not only having a dairy section but also keeping cattle for beef.{ Some{sheep}are kept and{winter barley} is grown, but some of the land is too wet and hilly for this. {Market gardening}also takes place in our area - cabbages, lettuce and soft fruit are grown and one producer is now changing over to grow early potatoes. There is also a{mink farm}at Treesmill
